titleStmt.title: Somewhat spoken to a weighty question concerning the magistrates protection of the innocent wherein is held forth the blessing and peace which nations ought to wait for and embrace in the later dayes ; with some considerations for the serious and wise in heart throughout this nation to ponder ... also a brief account of what the people called Quakers desire in reference to the civil government ... / by Isaac Penington the younger.
titleStmt.author: Penington, Isaac, 1616-1679.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the British Library.
